content.description: Start on the two obvious holds just in front of the tree. Move right to the rail then finish with moves to sloping top of boulder. A Marys Peak classic that you need to visit if your in the area. Would be four stars if it were taller.
content.protection: 2 pads preferable. Could use 1 pad and spotter.
content.location: Use the same parking and entry path as the pillars (44.508587, -123.572010). Rather than going down to the right to the pillars, keep going straight when you enter the path until you see a boulder on the left.

content.description:
Very short & very powerful.

 Start with one hand on the sharp crimp and the other on a low sidepull, move up and to the left for a slopey top-out.

 Terrible problem, I highly recommend it.
A nice short boulder with some cool holds on it. During sunset the boulder lights up orange for a beautiful session. I recommend a visit to Sunset Boulder as it is a short walk to a unique rock.
